conclusion: Analyze the p-V image and use the ideal gas law PV = nRT to determine heat transferred.
Gas expands from state A to state B and then to state C; volume increases from 1 × 10^-3 m^3 to 2 × 10^-3 m^3 and then to 3 × 10^-3 m^3.
Temperature of gas in state A is 27 °C.
Convert temperature from Celsius to Kelvin: 273 + 27 = 299 K.
Use ideal gas law to calculate number of moles: n ≈ 0.00017 mol.
Calculate change in internal energy ΔU: ΔU ≈ 0.0004 J.
Amount of heat transferred by gas from state A to state C is approximately 0.0004 J.
